If `true`, the Date picker is disabled and cannot be interacted with.

members.description: Represents the distance (gutter or margin) between the Date picker panel and the input element.

members.description: The first day of the week, where Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, etc

members.description:
The options to use when formatting the displayed value.

members.description: A function that takes a date and returns true if the date should not be selectable

members.name: locale
members.description:
The locale for formatting dates. If not set, will use the browser's locale.
Details: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl#locales_argument

members.name: max
members.description: The latest date that can be selected

members.name: min
members.description: The earliest date that can be selected

members.name: months
members.description: Number of months to show when range is `true`

members.name: monthsPerView
members.description:
Specifies how the next/previous buttons should navigate the calendar.
- single: The buttons will navigate by a single month at a time.
- months: The buttons will navigate by the number of months displayed per view.

members.name: name
members.description: The Date picker input name.

members.name: open
members.description: If `true`, the Date picker panel will be visible.

members.name: panelHeight
members.description: When set, it will override the height of the Date picker panel.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: The Date picker input placeholder text value

members.name: placement
members.description: Position of the Date picker panel

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates whether or not the Date picker input is required to be filled out before submitting the form.

members.name: skidding
members.description: Represents the skidding between the Date picker panel and the input element.

members.name: showOutsideDays
members.description: Whether to show days outside the month

members.name: strategy
members.description: Defines the strategy to position the Date picker panel

members.name: tentative
members.description: The date that is tentatively selected e.g. the start of a range selection

members.name: type
members.description: It defines how the calendar will behave, allowing single date selection, range selection, or multiple date selection

members.name: validationStatus
members.description: The validation status of the Select input.

members.name: value
members.description:
The select input value represents the currently selected date or range and can be used to reset the field to a previous value.
All dates are expected in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).

members.name: clear
members.description: Clears the selected value.

members.name: generateCalendarMonths
members.description:
Generates an array of JSX.Element representing calendar months.

If the type of the date picker is 'range' or 'multi' and the number of months is specified,
it generates an array of calendar months with the specified length. Each month will have an offset
and a class name based on its position in the array. The offset is used to determine the month to display,
and the class name is used for responsive design.

If the type of the date picker is not 'range' or 'multi', or if the number of months is not specified,
it generates an array with a single calendar month.

members.name: formatFocusedDate
members.description:
Extracts and returns the first date part from a given string.
When the type of the date picker is 'range' or 'multi', the first or initial date part of the value
should be the focused date in the calendar.

parameters.description: The value to be processed, can be a string.
parameters.name: value

members.name: autocapitalize
members.description:
Controls whether or not the input field should be capitalized and how.
Possible values are 'off', 'none', 'on', 'sentences', 'words', and 'characters'.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autocapitalize

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Specifies whether or not the input field should have autocomplete enabled.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete#values

members.name: autocorrect
members.description:
Controls whether or not the input field should have autocorrect enabled.
Possible values are 'on' and 'off'.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: If true, the input will be focused on component render

members.name: clearButtonLabel
members.description: The clear button aria label

members.name: debounceTime
members.description:
The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before emitting the `bqInput` event after the input value changes.
A value of 0 means no debouncing will occur.

members.name: disabled
members.description:
Indicates whether the input is disabled or not.
If `true`, the input is disabled and cannot be interacted with.

members.name: disableClear
members.description: If true, the clear button won't be displayed

members.name: form
members.description: The ID of the form that the input field belongs to.

members.name: formValidationMessage
members.description: The native form validation message (mandatory if `required` is set)

members.name: inputmode
members.description:
The inputmode attribute specifies what kind of input mechanism would be most helpful for users entering content into the input field.
This allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard while editing.
Possible values are 'none', 'text', 'decimal', 'numeric', 'tel', 'search', 'email', 'url', and 'date'.

members.name: max
members.description:
The maximum value that the input field can accept.
Only applies to date and number input types.

members.name: maxlength
members.description: The maximum number of characters that the input field can accept.

members.name: min
members.description:
The minimum value that the input field can accept.
Only applies to date and number input types.

members.name: minlength
members.description: The minimum number of characters that the input field can accept.

members.name: name
members.description: The input field name.

members.name: pattern
members.description:
Specifies a regular expression the form control's value should match.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/pattern

members.name: placeholder
members.description: The input placeholder text value

members.name: readonly
members.description: If true, the input field cannot be modified.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates whether or not the input field is required to be filled out before submitting the form.

members.name: step
members.description:
A number that specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to.
Valid for date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number, and range.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#step

members.name: type
members.description:
The type attribute specifies the type of input field to display.
Possible values are 'text', 'password', 'email', 'number', 'tel', 'search', 'url', and more.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#input_types

members.name: validationStatus
members.description: The validation status of the input.

members.description: The input value, it can be used to reset the input to a previous value

The `minValue` state is the only value when the slider type is `single`

members.description: It hold the left position of the Thumb for the value or the minimum value (if the slider type is `range`)

members.description: It hold the left position of the Thumb for the maximum value (if the slider type is `range`)

members.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `bqChange` event after each value change.

members.name: enableValueIndicator
members.description: If `true` it will show the value label on a side of the slider track area

members.name: gap
members.description: A number representing the amount to remain between the minimum and maximum values (only for range type).

members.name: max
members.description: A number representing the max value of the slider.

members.name: min
members.description: A number representing the min value of the slider.

members.name: name
members.description: Name of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair

members.name: step
members.description:
A number representing the step of the slider.
 Please notice that the value (or list of values if the slider type is `range`) will be rounded to the nearest multiple of `step`.

members.name: type
members.description: It defines the type of slider to display

members.name: value
members.description:
The value of the slider.
- If the slider type is `single`, the value is a number.
- If the slider type is `range`, the value is an array of two numbers (the first number represents the `min` value and the second number represents the `max` value).

members.name: enableTooltip
members.description: If `true`, a tooltip will be shown displaying the progress value

members.name: tooltipAlwaysVisible
members.description:
If `true`, a tooltip will always display the progress value.
It relies on enableTooltip and if enableTooltip is false, tooltipAlwaysVisible cannot be true.

declarations.description: The Textarea component is a multi-line text input control that is often used in a form to collect user inputs like comments or reviews. ## Examples
declarations.name: BqTextarea

cssParts.description: The component's base wrapper.
cssParts.name: base

cssParts.description: The textarea element.
cssParts.name: input

cssParts.description: The textarea label.
cssParts.name: label

cssParts.name: helper-info

cssParts.description: The helper text.
cssParts.name: helper-text

cssParts.name: helper-counter

slots.description: The textarea label.
slots.name: label

slots.description: The helper text.
slots.name: helper-text

members.name: autocapitalize
members.description:
Controls whether or not the textarea field should be capitalized and how.
Possible values are 'off', 'none', 'on', 'sentences', 'words', and 'characters'.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autocapitalize

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Specifies whether or not the textarea field should have autocomplete enabled.
See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete#values

members.name: autocorrect
members.description:
Controls whether or not the textarea field should have autocorrect enabled.
Possible values are 'on' and 'off'.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: If true, the textarea will be focused on component render

members.name: autoGrow
members.description:
If `true`, the textarea will automatically grow and shrink to fit its contents.
If `false`, the textarea will have a fixed height specified by the `rows` property.

members.name: debounceTime
members.description:
The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before emitting the `bqInput` event after the textarea value changes.
A value of 0 means no debouncing will occur.

members.name: disabled
members.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

members.name: disableResize
members.description: If `true`, it will block the user's ability to resize the textarea.

members.name: form
members.description: The ID of the form that the textarea field belongs to.

members.name: formValidationMessage
members.description: The native form validation message

members.name: maxlength
members.description:
The maximum number of characters that can be entered into the textarea (`0`: no limit).
When enabled, a character counter will be shown underneath the textarea.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the textarea element.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: The placeholder text to show when there is no value.

members.name: readonly
members.description: If true, the textarea field cannot be modified.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates whether or not the textarea field is required to be filled out before submitting the form.

members.name: rows
members.description: The number of visible text lines for the control. It must be a positive integer.

members.name: spellcheck
members.description: If true, the textarea content may be checked for spelling errors.

members.name: validationStatus
members.description: The validation status of the textarea.

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the textarea. It can be used to reset the textarea to a previous value.

members.name: wrap
members.description: Specifies how the text in a text area is to be wrapped when submitted in a form

events.description: Handler to be called when the textarea value changes.

bqBlur
events.description: Callback handler emitted when the textarea loses focus

events.name: bqChange
events.description:
Callback handler emitted when the textarea value has changed and the textarea loses focus.
This handler is called whenever the user finishes typing or pasting text into the textarea field and then clicks outside of the textarea field.

events.name: bqClear
events.description: Callback handler emitted when the textarea value has been cleared

events.name: bqFocus
events.description: Callback handler emitted when the textarea has received focus

events.name: bqInput
events.description:
Callback handler emitted when the textarea value changes.
This handler is called whenever the user types or pastes text into the textarea field.
